releaseNotes:
• Run tests using an agent job: Unified agent across Build, Release and Test allows for automation agents to be used for testing purposes as well. You can distribute tests using the multi-agent job setting. The multi-config job setting can be used to replicate tests in different configurations. More information
  • Test Impact Analysis: Automatically select and run only the tests needed to validate the code change.
  • Use the Visual Studio Test Platform Installer task to run tests without needing a full Visual Studio installation.
name: VSTest-sxs
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: testSelector
inputs.helpMarkDown:
• Test assembly: Use this option to specify one or more test assemblies that contain your tests. You can optionally specify a filter criteria to select only specific tests.
  • Test plan: Use this option to run tests from your test plan that have an automated test method associated with it.
  • Test run: Use this option when you are setting up an environment to run tests from the Test hub. This option should not be used when running tests in a continuous integration / continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipeline.
inputs.label: Select tests using

inputs.name: testAssemblyVer2
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Run tests from the specified files.
Ordered tests and webtests can be run by specifying the .orderedtest and .webtest files respectively. To run .webtest, Visual Studio 2017 Update 4 or higher is needed.

The file paths are relative to the search folder. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns. [More information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)
inputs.label: Test files

inputs.name: testPlan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a test plan containing test suites with automated test cases.
inputs.label: Test plan

inputs.name: testSuite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one or more test suites containing automated test cases. Test case work items must be associated with an automated test method. [Learn more.](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=847773
inputs.label: Test suite

inputs.name: testConfiguration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Test Configuration.
inputs.label: Test configuration

inputs.name: tcmTestRun
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test run based selection is used when triggering automated test runs from the test hub. This option cannot be used for running tests in the CI/CD pipeline.
inputs.label: Test Run

inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder to search for the test assemblies.
inputs.label: Search folder
inputs.name: searchFolder

inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder to store test results. When this input is not specified, results are stored in $(Agent.TempDirectory)/TestResults by default, which is cleaned at the end of a pipeline run. The results directory will always be cleaned up at the start of the vstest task before the tests are run. Relative folder path if provided will be considered relative to $(Agent.TempDirectory)
inputs.label: Test results folder
inputs.name: resultsFolder

inputs.label: Test filter criteria
inputs.name: testFiltercriteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional criteria to filter tests from Test assemblies. For example: `Priority=1|Name=MyTestMethod`. [More information](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj155796.aspx)

inputs.label: Run only impacted tests
inputs.name: runOnlyImpactedTests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Automatically select, and run only the tests needed to validate the code change. [More information](https://aka.ms/tialearnmore)

inputs.label: Number of builds after which all tests should be run
inputs.name: runAllTestsAfterXBuilds
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of builds after which to automatically run all tests. Test Impact Analysis stores the mapping between test cases and source code. It is recommended to regenerate the mapping by running all tests, on a regular basis.

To run UI tests, ensure that the agent is set to run in interactive mode. Setting up an agent to run interactively must be done before queueing the build / release. Checking this box does not configure the agent in interactive mode automatically. This option in the task is to only serve as a reminder to configure agent appropriately to avoid failures.

Hosted Windows agents from the VS 2015 and 2017 pools can be used to run UI tests.
[More information](https://aka.ms/uitestmoreinfo).
inputs.label: Test mix contains UI tests
inputs.name: uiTests
vsTestVersion
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of Visual Studio test to use. If latest is specified it chooses Visual Studio 2017 or Visual Studio 2015 depending on what is installed. Visual Studio 2013 is not supported. To run tests without needing Visual Studio on the agent, use the ‘Installed by tools installer’ option. Be sure to include the ‘Visual Studio Test Platform Installer’ task to acquire the test platform from nuget.
inputs.label: Test platform version
Path to vstest.console.exe
inputs.name: vstestLocation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to VSTest.
Path to runsettings or testsettings file to use with the tests.
inputs.label: Settings file
inputs.name: runSettingsFile

inputs.label: Override test run parameters
inputs.name: overrideTestrunParameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override parameters defined in the `TestRunParameters` section of runsettings file or `Properties` section of testsettings file. For example: `-key1 value1 -key2 value2`. Note: Properties specified in testsettings file can be accessed via the TestContext using Visual Studio 2017 Update 4 or higher
Directory path to custom test adapters. Adapters residing in the same folder as the test assemblies are automatically discovered.
inputs.label: Path to custom test adapters
inputs.name: pathtoCustomTestAdapters

inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, tests will run in parallel leveraging available cores of the machine. This will override the MaxCpuCount if specified in your runsettings file. [Click here](https://aka.ms/paralleltestexecution) to learn more about how tests are run in parallel.
inputs.label: Run tests in parallel on multi-core machines
inputs.name: runInParallel

inputs.helpMarkDown: Runs the tests in an isolated process. This makes vstest.console.exe process less likely to be stopped on an error in the tests, but tests might run slower. This option currently cannot be used when running with the multi-agent job setting.
inputs.label: Run tests in isolation
inputs.name: runTestsInIsolation

inputs.helpMarkDown: Collect code coverage information from the test run.
inputs.label: Code coverage enabled
inputs.name: codeCoverageEnabled

inputs.helpMarkDown:
Other console options that can be passed to vstest.console.exe, as documented here.

These options are not supported and will be ignored when running tests using the ‘Multi agent’ parallel setting of an agent job or when running tests using ‘Test plan’ or 'Test run' option or when a custom batching option is selected. The options can be specified using a settings file instead.
inputs.label: Other console options
inputs.name: otherConsoleOptions

options.basedOnTestCases: Based on number of tests and agents
options.basedOnExecutionTime: Based on past running time of tests

inputs.name: distributionBatchType
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A batch is a group of tests. A batch of tests runs its tests at the same time and results are published for the batch. If the job in which the task runs is set to use multiple agents, each agent picks up any available batches of tests to run in parallel.

Based on the number of tests and agents: Simple batching based on the number of tests and agents participating in the test run.

Based on past running time of tests: This batching considers past running time to create batches of tests such that each batch has approximately equal running time.

Based on test assemblies: Tests from an assembly are batched together.
inputs.label: Batch tests

inputs.name: batchingBasedOnAgentsOption
inputs.helpMarkDown: Simple batching based on the number of tests and agents participating in the test run. When the batch size is automatically determined, each batch contains `(total number of tests / number of agents)` tests. If a batch size is specified, each batch will contain the specified number of tests.
inputs.label: Batch options
Number of tests per batch
inputs.name: customBatchSizeValue
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify batch size

inputs.name: batchingBasedOnExecutionTimeOption
inputs.helpMarkDown: This batching considers past running time to create batches of tests such that each batch has approximately equal running time. Quick running tests will be batched together, while longer running tests may belong to a separate batch. When this option is used with the multi-agent job setting, total test time is reduced to a minimum.
inputs.label: Batch options
Running time (sec) per batch
inputs.name: customRunTimePerBatchValue
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the running time (sec) per batch

Choosing this option will not distribute tests across agents when the task is running in a multi-agent job.
Each of the selected test(s) will be repeated on each agent.
The option is not applicable when the agent job is configured to run with no parallelism or with the multi-config option.
inputs.label: Replicate tests instead of distributing when multiple agents are used in the job
inputs.name: dontDistribute

inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a name for the test run.
inputs.label: Test run title
inputs.name: testRunTitle

inputs.helpMarkDown: Build platform against which the tests should be reported. If you have defined a variable for platform in your build task, use that here.
inputs.label: Build platform
inputs.name: platform

inputs.helpMarkDown: Build configuration against which the tests should be reported. If you have defined a variable for configuration in your build task, use that here.
inputs.label: Build configuration
inputs.name: configuration

inputs.helpMarkDown: Opt in/out of publishing run level attachments.
inputs.label: Upload test attachments
inputs.name: publishRunAttachments

inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting this option will fail the task if specified minimum number of tests is not run.
inputs.label: Fail the task if a minimum number of tests are not run.
inputs.name: failOnMinTestsNotRun

inputs.label: Minimum # of tests
inputs.name: minimumExpectedTests
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the minimum # of tests that should be run for the task to succeed. Total tests executed is calculated as the sum of passed, failed and aborted tests.
Collect advanced diagnostics in case of catastrophic failures.
inputs.label: Collect advanced diagnostics in case of catastrophic failures
inputs.name: diagnosticsEnabled
collectDumpOn
inputs.helpMarkDown: Collect process dump and attach to test run report.
inputs.label: Collect process dump and attach to test run report

inputs.helpMarkDown: Selecting this option will rerun any failed tests until they pass or the maximum # of attempts is reached.
inputs.label: Rerun failed tests
inputs.name: rerunFailedTests
rerunType
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when failure rate crosses the specified threshold. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.
You can specify % failures or # of failed tests as a threshold.
inputs.label: Do not rerun if test failures exceed specified threshold
% failure
inputs.name: rerunFailedThreshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when failure rate crosses the specified threshold. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.

inputs.label: # of failed tests
inputs.name: rerunFailedTestCasesMaxLimit
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option to avoid rerunning tests when number of failed test cases crosses specified limit. This is applicable if any environment issues leads to massive failures.

inputs.label: Maximum # of attempts
inputs.name: rerunMaxAttempts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the maximum # of times a failed test should be retried. If a test passes before the maximum # of attempts is reached, it will not be rerun further.

description: Run unit and functional tests (Selenium, Appium, Coded UI test, etc.) using the Visual Studio Test (VsTest) runner. Test frameworks that have a Visual Studio test adapter such as MsTest, xUnit, NUnit, Chutzpah (for JavaScript tests using QUnit, Mocha and Jasmine), etc. can be run. Tests can be distributed on multiple agents using this task (version 2).
